question: [File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_transaction()] [Integer Overflow] Can an attacker submit a transaction with version number close to i64::MAX causing overflow when converting user_txn.info.version.0 (u64) to i64 at line 103, potentially corrupting transaction_version tracking or causing indexer crashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_transaction()] [Timestamp Overflow] Can maliciously crafted timestamp values in user_txn.timestamp.0 cause parse_timestamp() to panic at line 104, resulting in indexer service DoS and preventing token data from being indexed? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_write_table_item()] [Type Conversion] Does the conversion from u64 version to i64 at line 103 properly handle values above i64::MAX, or can this cause silent truncation leading to incorrect transaction versioning in the database? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_write_table_item()] [BigDecimal Precision] Can extremely large property_version values in token_id.property_version (BigDecimal) cause precision loss or overflow when stored in PostgreSQL numeric fields, leading to incorrect token identification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_write_table_item()] [Amount Overflow] Does ensure_not_negative() at line 276 properly handle BigDecimal values that overflow during arithmetic operations, or can attackers craft token amounts that bypass validation through overflow wrapping? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_transaction()] [Panic on Unwrap] The code calls .unwrap() on from_write_table_item() at line 116 - can a malformed WriteTableItem with invalid data structures cause deserialization failures leading to indexer panics and service unavailability? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_transaction()] [Panic on Unwrap] Line 122 calls TokenData::from_write_table_item().unwrap() without error handling - can specially crafted token data with invalid fields cause panic and crash the indexer process? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_transaction()] [Panic on Unwrap] CollectionData::from_write_table_item().unwrap() at line 130 could panic on malformed collection data - can attackers deliberately create invalid collections to DoS the indexer? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_transaction()] [Panic on Unwrap] Line 139 unwraps from_delete_table_item() - can malicious delete operations with corrupted key data trigger panics preventing token deletion indexing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_transaction()] [Panic on Unwrap] CurrentTokenPendingClaim::from_write_table_item().unwrap() at line 154 has no error handling - can invalid pending claim data cause indexer crashes during token transfer processing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_transaction()] [Panic on Unwrap] Line 163 unwraps from_delete_table_item() for pending claims - can attackers exploit malformed delete operations to cause service disruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_write_table_item()] [Null Pointer Panic] Line 241 calls table_item.data.as_ref().unwrap() assuming data is always present - can transactions with missing table_item.data cause null pointer panics? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_delete_table_item()] [Null Pointer Panic] Line 299 calls table_item.data.as_ref().unwrap() without checking if data exists - can delete operations with null data fields crash the indexer? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: get_table_handle_to_owner()] [Panic on Unwrap] Line 364 unwraps get_table_handle_to_owner() - can malformed resource writes with invalid table handles cause indexer failures during batch processing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: get_table_handle_to_owner()] [Data Access Panic] Line 402 calls resource.data.as_ref().unwrap() - can resources with missing data fields trigger panics when building table handle mappings? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_transaction()] [State Overwrites] The tokens HashMap at line 89 uses (token_data_id_hash, property_version) as key - can attackers create hash collisions through SHA256 manipulation to overwrite legitimate token entries causing data loss? [File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_transaction()] [Race Condition] Multiple WriteSetChanges in the same transaction can insert into tokens HashMap at line 171 - is insertion order deterministic, or can race conditions cause last-write-wins behavior hiding earlier token states? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_transaction()] [Ownership Corruption] current_token_ownerships HashMap at line 90 uses (token_data_id_hash, property_version, owner_address) as key - can collisions in this composite key cause ownership records to be silently overwritten? [File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_transaction()] [Data Loss] current_token_datas HashMap at line 94 uses only token_data_id_hash as key - if multiple token data entries share the same hash within a transaction, will earlier entries be lost during deduplication at line 194? [File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_transaction()] [Collection Overwrite] current_collection_datas HashMap at line 96 deduplicates by collection_data_id_hash - can malicious actors trigger hash collisions to corrupt collection metadata in the same transaction batch? [File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_transaction()] [Claims Manipulation] current_token_claims HashMap at line 98 uses 4-tuple key including from/to addresses - can carefully crafted addresses cause hash collisions enabling pending claim overwrites? [File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_transaction()] [Deduplication Logic] The HashMap.insert() operations at lines 182-215 replace existing values - is this intended behavior, or can it hide important intermediate state changes within a single transaction? [File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_transaction()] [Lost Updates] When deduplicating tokens at line 171, if property_version is identical but token_properties differ, does the last value win silently discarding property mutations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_write_table_item()] [Negative Amount Bypass] Line 276 calls ensure_not_negative(token.amount) - can attackers exploit BigDecimal arithmetic to create negative amounts that pass this check through underflow or precision manipulation? [File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/token_models/tokens.rs] [Function: from_delete_table_item()] [Zero Balance Tracking] Line 332 sets amount to BigDecimal::zero() for deleted tokens - does downstream code properly handle zero-balance tokens, or can this create ghost ownership records in current_token_ownerships?
